cont.entity_a: Rough adjustment release lock is under the collar lock and a pain to adjust. Fine adjustment sticks. Body does not slide smoothly in the collar. Prone to become hard to adjust vertically because wood dust gets down into it. Retainer snap ring on the vertical adjustment shaft has broken twice. Base is very hard to adjust. Easy to adjust height.
Generally junk. Porter Cable lasted twenty years. Usually lasts a year or so for trade work. Router is durable and well made.
Powerful, quiet, and versatile. Capable of producing 2.25 HP of mechanical energy. Plenty of power.
Soft start is softer than older Freud router rated at the same power. Soft start and variable speed are great features. Soft start feature is nice when routing by hand. Starts up gently.
Fits perfectly on the router table base.
Variable speed is a major plus. Variable speed RPM allows optimal chip loads and feed rates. Variable speed is great for different size bits and types of wood.
Higher quality than other brands like DeWalt and Makita. Quality product, grips bit well and bit does not walk in chuck.
Need to replace bearings every so often. Front spindle bearing is retained with two Phillips head machine screws on the outer race, with no bearing clamp.
Acrylic base plates made for all 1617 router bases. Heavy and bulky, but adjustments lock in and stay.
Switch did not work half the time. Power switch failed on second use.
Router is easy to control and becomes an extension of the user. Router was up to the challenge of making tongue and groove joints in old flooring. Router works flawlessly on various projects.
Easy depth adjustment and extra screws for custom faceplates. Solid wrenches included. Does not come with a 1/8 inch collet. Collet chuck was too small to accept a standard 1/2 inch shanked bit.
